meanings.definition: Regarded or considered in a specified way.
meanings.sent1: The old book was deemed valuable by the librarian.
meanings.sent2: The painting was deemed beautiful by the art critic.
meanings.sent3: The cat deemed the empty box as its new castle.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was deemed as bright as the morning sun.
meanings.sent5: The teacher deemed the student's effort exceptional.

meanings.sent1: The mysterious package was deemed suspicious by the detective.
meanings.sent2: The weather was deemed unpredictable by the meteorologist.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel deemed the acorn too big to carry up the tree.
meanings.sent4: His words were deemed as sharp as a double-edged sword.
meanings.sent5: The cake was deemed delicious by everyone at the party.

meanings.sent1: The deemed winner of the contest received a shiny trophy.
meanings.sent2: The deemed date for the event was set for next Friday.
meanings.sent3: The dog deemed the couch as its favorite napping spot.
meanings.sent4: The stars deemed the night sky their canvas for twinkling art.
meanings.sent5: The judge deemed the verdict final and closed the case.
